The expert analyzed the claim made by Je: 2. The expert examined different ways to measure dropout frequency, including the "status dropout rate" and the "event dropout rate."
The expert found that Bush: s claim of one-third of American students dropping out, unable to go to college or start a career, was significantly inflated according to both measures.
Bush: s staff argued that high numbers of minority students, particularly black and Hispanic students, not graduating from high school supported their claim, but the expert did not find evidence to support this reasoning.
